reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Farm Practices Protection (Right to Farm) Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Specialty Farm Operations Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 269/2016, January 1, 2017]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Farm Practices Protection (Right to Farm) Act.
The following specialty wood crops are prescribed for the purpose of paragraph (f) of the definition of "farm operation" in section 1 of the Act:
The following types of aquaculture are prescribed for the purpose of paragraph (h) of the definition of "farm operation" in section 1 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: aquaculture and prescribed activities within the meaning of the Pacific Aquaculture Regulations, SOR/2010-270 (Canada), if conducted

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under an aquaculture licence issued under that regulation, and
in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence and with that regulation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the growing of aquatic plants that may be distributed to the public for human consumption, if conducted

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under an aquatic plant culture licence issued under the Fish and Seafood Licensing Regulation, and
in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence and with that regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following types of exotic animals are prescribed for the purpose of paragraph (n) of the definition of "farm operation" in section 1 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: partridge species, pheasant species, quail, silkie and squab.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Farm Practices Protection (Right to Farm) Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 131, section 12 (3)]
